location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.3166 of 1853 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter relates to reparations paid to the victims of violations of the maritime truce, from monies recovered by the British authorities as compensation. Malet encloses with his letter an extract (folio 202) from a despatch from the Honourable Court of Directors, dated 4 May 1853. The despatch relates to the payment of compensation directly to the victims of violations of the maritime truce, and not to the ruler of whom the person is a subject.
